intro: Anthocercis genistifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, sunny environments, often found on rocky slopes and coastal areas. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. The species is part of the Rhamnaceae family, which includes other shrubs and trees with similar structural and ecological characteristics.
